text: Louis-Edmond Hamelin, (21 March 1923 - 11 February 2020) was a Canadian geographer, professor, and author. Born in Saint-Didace, Quebec, Canada, he was best known for his studies of Northern Canada. Hamelin created the Centre for Northern Studies at the Université Laval in Québec and was rector of the Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières from 1978 to 1983. He was also a member of the Northwest Territories Legislative Council. Hamelin specialized in Northern and Aboriginal peoples studies. Hamelin died on 11 February 2020 at the age of 96. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Academics of Université Laval Category:Geographers
